728892f-a.text:
360 Guyon Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Falcon Avenue, showing the Guyon-Clark House. The historv of the house is traced to Jaques Guyon who received a land grant in 1664, then to the marriage of one of his descendants to the Clark family and the inheritance of the house by Miss S. Gertrude Clark. This is the south side of the house. It was razed in 1925.
Spring 1924.
P.L. Sperr
(2)
A view of the north side of the house.
Spring 1924.
P.L. Sperr
(3)
The barn on the Guyon-9lark property. It stood about
100 feet southwest of the house.
Sprinm 1924
P.L. Sperr
728892f-a.folder: Guyon Avenue & Falcon Avenue, Staten Island, NY
